carousel.sintesis: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela, specifically the capture of President Maduro. While Latin America is experiencing a polarized reaction to this event, ranging from support to condemnation, and Russia/CIS frame it as an act of aggression triggering international condemnation, North America focuses on the domestic and international implications of the US's actions, potentially framing them differently. Europe, the Middle East, and Asia-Pacific, though not directly involved, view the intervention through the lens of broader geopolitical instability and power struggles, highlighting the potential disruption to existing international norms and regional balances.
carousel.sintesis_en: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela, specifically the capture of President Maduro. While Latin America is experiencing a polarized reaction to this event, ranging from support to condemnation, and Russia/CIS frame it as an act of aggression triggering international condemnation, North America focuses on the domestic and international implications of the US's actions, potentially framing them differently. particulas.titulo_en: How China quietly became the world’s climate policy leader
particulas.description:
In contrast to the United States, which innovates and influences, and the European Union, which regulates, China has become the world’s climate doer.
Beyond the headlines of decoupling, tariffs and geopolitical rivalry, an underappreciated global transformation is quietly under way: China, often framed as the world’s factory and climate laggard, has, almost by stealth, become the world’s undisputed climate leader.
This may sit uncomfortably with Western policymakers, and perhaps even with some..

carousel.sintesis: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela, specifically the capture of President Maduro. While Latin America focuses on the event's implications for regional stability and international law, and Russia/CIS highlight its condemnation and impact on geopolitical alliances, North America centers the narrative on the US's actions and internal debates. There is a general consensus across all regions on the importance and impact of the intervention, but strong divergence in interpreting its legitimacy and consequences.

carousel.sintesis: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela, resulting in the capture of President Maduro. Divergences exist in the framing: North America emphasizes the justification and domestic implications of US action, while Latin America primarily focuses on the impact on regional stability and sovereignty. Russia and the CIS strongly condemn the US action, whereas there's no clear consensus on the legality and impact of this event across all regions.
carousel.sintesis_en: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela, resulting in the capture of President Maduro. Divergences exist in the framing: North America emphasizes the justification and domestic implications of US action, while Latin America primarily focuses on the impact on regional stability and sovereignty. Russia and the CIS strongly condemn the US action, whereas there's no clear consensus on the legality and impact of this event across all regions.

Antes, su canciller, Jean-Noël Barrot, afirmó que la operación militar que llevó al secuestro de Maduro “contraviene el principio de no uso de la fuerza, fundamental para el derecho internacional”.

carousel.sintesis: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela and the capture of President Maduro. Divergences emerge strongly, with North America focusing on the internal US debates surrounding the legality and implications of the action, while Latin America concentrates on the event's impact on regional stability and sovereignty. Russia and CIS nations share a consensus of condemnation and highlight the impact on global oil markets, a view seemingly absent or less emphasized in other regions.
carousel.sintesis_en: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela and the capture of President Maduro. Divergences emerge strongly, with North America focusing on the internal US debates surrounding the legality and implications of the action, while Latin America concentrates on the event's impact on regional stability and sovereignty. Russia and CIS nations share a consensus of condemnation and highlight the impact on global oil markets, a view seemingly absent or less emphasized in other regions.

Lamentablemente en el canal 14, supuestamente, un canal al servicio de la comunidad, de probada imparcialidad y objetividad, no cubre la visión que necesitamos, el espacio importante internacional se le ha otorgado a la cadena francesa Fra

particulas.description: Swiss investigators are probing what caused a fire in a bar at an Alpine ski resort that left around 40 people dead and another 115 injured during a New Year's celebration. The severity of the burns has made it very difficult to identify bodies, and Swiss authorities say it could take weeks before all victims have been identified. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot spoke to several witnesses of the fire in Crans-Montana.

particulas.title: A fire in a Swiss ski resort bar kills 40 people: What we know so far
particulas.titulo_es: A fire in a Swiss ski resort bar kills 40 people: What we know so far
particulas.titulo_en: A fire in a Swiss ski resort bar kills 40 people: What we know so far
particulas.description:
Swiss investigators are probing what caused a fire in a bar at an Alpine ski resort that left around 40 people dead and another 115 injured during a New Year's celebration.
 
Most injuries, many of them serious, occurred when the blaze swept through the crowded bar less than two hours after midnight in southwestern Switzerland.

particulas.title: First victim of Crans-Montana fire identified as investigations continue
particulas.titulo_es: First victim of Crans-Montana fire identified as investigations continue
particulas.titulo_en: First victim of Crans-Montana fire identified as investigations continue
particulas.description: Investigations into the victims of the Crans-Montana fire are still ongoing, with authorities having revealed one identity so far. It could take weeks before they are able to confirm identities and nationalities of the victims due to the severity of the burns. In the meantime, five days of national mourning have been announced. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot tell us more live from Crans-Montana.

particulas.description: A fire at a bar in the upscale Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana just north of the Matterhorn, in Switzerland, has killed dozens of people and injured nearly 100 after breaking out around 1:30 a.m. at the Constellation bar, with investigators now working to determine the cause as authorities say there is no indication the blaze was terror-related. France24 correspondent, John Zarocostas, reports the latest.

carousel.sintesis: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela, resulting in the capture of President Maduro. Latin America focuses on the immediate regional implications and diverse reactions, while Norteamerica centers on US domestic debates regarding interventionism and legality. Rusia_CIS highlights condemnation and geopolitical fallout, contrasting with Europe and other regions where the event competes with other major domestic/regional crises for dominance in the news cycle.

Latin America focuses on the immediate regional implications and diverse reactions, while Norteamerica centers on US domestic debates regarding interventionism and legality. Rusia_CIS highlights condemnation and geopolitical fallout, contrasting with Europe and other regions where the event competes with other major domestic/regional crises for dominance in the news cycle.

particulas.description: Swiss authorities said on Saturday they had opened a criminal investigation into two French managers of a bar in a Swiss ski resort after a New Year’s Eve fire killed 40 revellers. The blaze, which broke out at a bar in Crans-Montana, injured 16 French nationals, while nine remain unaccounted for, according to an updated report released by the French Foreign Ministry.

particulas.description: As Switzerland mourns, authorities are continuing to investigate the cause of the deadly fire and now believe it was triggered by sparklers placed on champagne bottles that came too close to the bar’s ceiling. Investigators are also examining whether the venue’s materials met fire safety regulations. Meanwhile, families anxiously await news of their loved ones, as some victims have been transferred to specialized burn units in hospitals in France and Italy, while six people remain unidentified.

carousel.sintesis: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela and the capture of President Maduro. While North America and Latin America primarily focus on the immediate political and legal ramifications of the intervention, creating a division in support vs. condemnation, Russia and the CIS frame it as an act of aggression sparking condemnation and impacting geopolitical alliances, specifically targeting US foreign policy. No real consensus is present, but all narratives acknowledge the significant impact on international relations.
carousel.sintesis_en: The core issue is the US military intervention in Venezuela and the capture of President Maduro. While North America and Latin America primarily focus on the immediate political and legal ramifications of the intervention, creating a division in support vs. condemnation, Russia and the CIS frame it as an act of aggression sparking condemnation and impacting geopolitical alliances, specifically targeting US foreign policy. No real consensus is present, but all narratives acknowledge the significant impact on international relations.

particulas.titulo_es: 'It was like seeing people run out of hell' when Crans-Montana fire broke out
particulas.titulo_en: 'It was like seeing people run out of hell' when Crans-Montana fire broke out
particulas.description: As investigations into how the deadly blaze could have started in a Crans-Montana bar on New Year's Eve, testimonies are emerging about what they saw that night. At least 40 were killed and 115 others were injured, while many others are missing. Police are struggling to identify the victims due to the severity of the burns. FRANCE 2'4's Olivia Bizot spoke to an Italian tourist who saw the fire that night.

particulas.titulo_en: Crans-Montana fire: what we know so far about how it could have started
particulas.description: Switzerland is reeling from the deadly fire in ski resort Crans-Montana. Some 47 people were killed on New Years eve, more than one hundred people were severely burned. The first emergency is to treat the wounded and identify victims. Authorities are also investigating what caused the fire and whether the bar violated security norms.
